intro: Sibbaldia altaica, commonly known as the Altai sibbaldia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats at high altitudes. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Sibbaldia altaica is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine environments.
